intro: Randia tenuiflora, commonly known as slenderflower randia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, elliptic leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, white to pink flowers are borne in clusters and are accompanied by distinctive bracts. Randia tenuiflora is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
